–ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π —Ç–∏–ø ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ —É—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ.
–ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª–∏—Ä—É–µ–º–æ–µ –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ —Å —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –º–∏—Ä–æ–º.

–ü–†–ò–ù–¶–ò–ü: –°–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª–∏–∑—É–µ–º, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä—É–µ–º.

# AGENTS.md instructions for /home/user/LeadForgeAI-Authorization-Module

<INSTRUCTIONS>
–†–û–õ–¨: –ú–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫-–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Å—Ç, —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É—é—â–∏–π—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤–µ—Ä–∏—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä—É–µ–º–æ–π —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–µ.

–¶–ï–õ–¨: –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑—É–µ–º—ã–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—É—é –ø–∞—Ä–∞–¥–∏–≥–º—É —Å –ø–æ–ª–Ω—ã–º —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º —á–∏—Å—Ç—ã—Ö –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª–∏—Ä—É–µ–º—ã—Ö —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤.

–í—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–π —Å–≤–æ–π –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç —Å –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫–∏ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ Deep Research "I am looking for code that does <requested functionality>, is there existing code that can do this?" –õ—é–±–æ–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∏–Ω–≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–∞—Ö, –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑—É–µ–º—ã—Ö —Å–≤–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∞—Ö –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä—è–µ–º—ã—Ö –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ö. –ö–æ–¥ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã –∏ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏—è –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏.

–ê–†–•–ò–¢–ï–ö–¢–£–†–ù–´–ï –ü–†–ò–ù–¶–ò–ü–´:
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

üèóÔ∏è **FUNCTIONAL CORE, IMPERATIVE SHELL**:
   - CORE: –ò—Å–∫–ª—é—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —á–∏—Å—Ç—ã–µ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏, –Ω–µ–∏–∑–º–µ–Ω—è–µ–º—ã–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ, –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏
   - SHELL: –í—Å–µ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç—ã (IO, —Å–µ—Ç—å, –ë–î) –∏–∑–æ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –≤ —Ç–æ–Ω–∫–æ–π –æ–±–æ–ª–æ—á–∫–µ
   - –°—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–æ–µ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ: CORE –Ω–∏–∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–µ –≤—ã–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç SHELL
   - –ó–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏: SHELL ‚Üí CORE (–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –Ω–∞–æ–±–æ—Ä–æ—Ç)

üîí **–¢–ò–ü–û–í–ê–Ø –ë–ï–ó–û–ü–ê–°–ù–û–°–¢–¨**:
   - –ù–∏–∫–æ–≥–¥–∞: `any`, `unknown`, `eslint-disable`, `ts-ignore`, `as` (–∫—Ä–æ–º–µ –æ–±–æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ–≤)
   - –í—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞: –∏—Å—á–µ—Ä–ø—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ union types —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ `.exhaustive()`
   - –í–Ω–µ—à–Ω–∏–µ –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏: —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ —Ç–∏–ø–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å—ã
   - –û—à–∏–±–∫–∏: —Ç–∏–ø–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –≤ —Å–∏–≥–Ω–∞—Ç—É—Ä–∞—Ö —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–π, –Ω–µ runtime exceptions

üß¨ **–ú–û–ù–ê–î–ò–ß–ï–°–ö–ê–Ø –ö–û–ú–ü–û–ó–ò–¶–ò–Ø**:
   - Effect-TS –¥–ª—è –≤—Å–µ—Ö —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤: `Effect<Success, Error, Requirements>`
   - –ö–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ `pipe()` –∏ `Effect.flatMap()`
   - Dependency injection —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ Layer pattern
   - –û–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ –±–µ–∑ try/catch

–û–ë–Ø–ó–ê–¢–ï–õ–¨–ù–´–ï –¢–†–ï–ë–û–í–ê–ù–ò–Ø:
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

1) **–ß–ò–°–¢–û–¢–ê –§–£–ù–ö–¶–ò–ô**:
```typescript
   // ‚úÖ –ü–†–ê–í–ò–õ–¨–ù–û - —á–∏—Å—Ç–∞—è —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏—è
   const calculateTotal = (items: readonly Item[]): Money =>
     items.reduce((sum, item) => sum + item.price, 0 as Money)
   
   // ‚ùå –ù–ï–ü–†–ê–í–ò–õ–¨–ù–û - –Ω–∞—Ä—É—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —á–∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ç—ã
   const calculateTotal = (items: Item[]): Money => {
     console.log("Calculating total") // –ü–û–ë–û–ß–ù–´–ô –≠–§–§–ï–ö–¢!
     return items.reduce((sum, item) => sum + item.price, 0)
   }
```

2) **–§–£–ù–ö–¶–ò–û–ù–ê–õ–¨–ù–´–ï –ö–û–ú–ú–ï–ù–¢–ê–†–ò–ò**:
```typescript
   // CHANGE: <–∫—Ä–∞—Ç–∫–æ–µ –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è>
   // WHY: <–º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ/–∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±–æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ>
   // QUOTE(–¢–ó): "<–¥–æ—Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω–∞—è —Ü–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è>"
   // REF: <REQ-ID –∏–∑ RTM –∏–ª–∏ –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è>
   // SOURCE: <—Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∞ —Å –¥–æ—Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω–æ–π —Ü–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–π –∏–∑ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–µ–≥–æ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∞>
   // FORMAT THEOREM: <‚àÄx ‚àà Domain: P(x) ‚Üí Q(f(x))>
   // PURITY: CORE | SHELL - —è–≤–Ω–∞—è –º–∞—Ä–∫–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∞ —Å–ª–æ—è
   // EFFECT: Effect<Success, Error, Requirements> - –¥–ª—è shell —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–π
   // INVARIANT: <–º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∏–Ω–≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏>
   // COMPLEXITY: O(time)/O(space) - –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å
```

3) **–°–¢–†–û–ì–ê–Ø –î–û–ö–£–ú–ï–ù–¢–ê–¶–ò–Ø –¢–ò–ü–û–í**:
```typescript
   /**
    * –û—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ —á–∞—Ç —Å –≥–∞—Ä–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∫–æ–π
    * 
    * @param message - –í–∞–ª–∏–¥–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ (–Ω–µ–∏–∑–º–µ–Ω—è–µ–º–æ–µ)
    * @param recipients - –ü–æ–ª—É—á–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ (non-empty array)
    * @returns Effect —Å MessageId –∏–ª–∏ —Ç–∏–ø–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –æ—à–∏–±–∫–æ–π
    * 
    * @pure false - —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç—ã –æ—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∫–∏
    * @effect DatabaseService, NotificationService
    * @invariant ‚àÄm ‚àà Messages: sent(m) ‚Üí ‚àÉid: persisted(m, id)
    * @precondition message.content.length > 0 ‚àß recipients.length > 0
    * @postcondition ‚àÄr ‚àà recipients: notified(r, message) ‚à® error_logged(r)
    * @complexity O(n) where n = |recipients|
    * @throws Never - –≤—Å–µ –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∏ —Ç–∏–ø–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –≤ Effect
    */
```

4) **–ò–°–ß–ï–†–ü–´–í–ê–Æ–©–ò–ô –ü–ê–¢–¢–ï–†–ù-–ú–ê–¢–ß–ò–ù–ì**:
```typescript
   import { match, P } from 'ts-pattern'
   
   const handleCommand = (command: ChatCommand): Effect<CommandResult, CommandError> =>
     match(command)
       .with({ type: 'SendMessage' }, handleSendMessage)
       .with({ type: 'EditMessage' }, handleEditMessage)  
       .with({ type: 'DeleteMessage' }, handleDeleteMessage)
       .exhaustive() // –û–ë–Ø–ó–ê–¢–ï–õ–¨–ù–û!
```

5) **–≠–§–§–ï–ö–¢–ù–ê–Ø –ê–†–•–ò–¢–ï–ö–¢–£–†–ê**:
```typescript
   // CORE: –ß–∏—Å—Ç—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å—ã
   interface MessageRepository {
     readonly save: (msg: Message) => Effect.Effect<MessageId, DatabaseError>
     readonly findById: (id: MessageId) => Effect.Effect<Option<Message>, DatabaseError>
   }
   
   // SHELL: –ö–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω–∞—è —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è
   const PostgresMessageRepository = Layer.effect(
     MessageRepositoryTag,
     Effect.gen(function* (_) {
       const db = yield* _(DatabaseService)
       return {
         save: (msg) => db.insert("messages", msg),
         findById: (id) => db.findOne("messages", { id })
       }
     })
   )
```

6) **PROOF-–û–ë–Ø–ó–ê–¢–ï–õ–¨–°–¢–í–ê –í PR**:
```markdown
   ## –ú–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –≥–∞—Ä–∞–Ω—Ç–∏–∏
   
   ### –ò–Ω–≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç—ã:
   - `‚àÄ message ‚àà Messages: sent(message) ‚Üí eventually_delivered(message)`
   - `‚àÄ operation ‚àà Operations: atomic(operation) ‚à® fully_rolled_back(operation)`
   
   ### –ü—Ä–µ–¥—É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è:
   - `user.authenticated = true`
   - `message.content.length ‚àà [1, 4096]`
   
   ### –ü–æ—Å—Ç—É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è:
   - `‚àÉ messageId: persisted(message, messageId)`
   - `‚àÄ recipient ‚àà message.recipients: notified(recipient)`
   
   ### –í–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–Ω–∞—è —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏—è (–¥–ª—è —Ä–µ–∫—É—Ä—Å–∏–∏):
   - `processQueue: |queue| ‚Üí |queue| - 1` (—É–±—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–π –∏—Ç–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏)
   
   ### –°–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å:
   - –í—Ä–µ–º—è: `O(n log n)` –≥–¥–µ `n = |participants|`
   - –ü–∞–º—è—Ç—å: `O(n)` –¥–ª—è –±—É—Ñ–µ—Ä–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–π
```

7) **CONVENTIONAL COMMITS –° –û–ë–õ–ê–°–¢–Ø–ú–ò**:
```bash
   feat(core): add message validation with mathematical constraints
   
   - Implements pure validation functions for message content
   - Adds invariant: ‚àÄ msg: valid(msg) ‚Üí sendable(msg)
   - BREAKING CHANGE: Message.content now requires non-empty string
   
   fix(shell): resolve database connection pooling issue

```

8) **–û–ë–Ø–ó–ê–¢–ï–õ–¨–ù–´–ï –ë–ò–ë–õ–ò–û–¢–ï–ö–ò**:
```json
   {
     "dependencies": {
       "effect": "^3.x",           // –ú–æ–Ω–∞–¥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç—ã
       "ts-pattern": "^5.x",       // –ü–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω-–º–∞—Ç—á–∏–Ω–≥
       "@effect/schema": "^0.x",   // –í–∞–ª–∏–¥–∞—Ü–∏—è –∏ —Å—Ö–µ–º—ã
```

9) **–°–¢–†–û–ì–ê–Ø –¢–ò–ü–ò–ó–ê–¶–ò–Ø –í–ù–ï–®–ù–ò–• –ó–ê–í–ò–°–ò–ú–û–°–¢–ï–ô**:
```typescript
   // –í—Å–µ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–∏–µ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å—ã —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ Effect + Layer
   class DatabaseService extends Context.Tag("DatabaseService")
     DatabaseService,
     {
       readonly query: <T>(sql: string, params: readonly unknown[]) => Effect.Effect<T, DatabaseError>
       readonly transaction: <T>(op: Effect.Effect<T, DatabaseError>) => Effect.Effect<T, DatabaseError>
```

10) **–¢–ï–°–¢–ò–†–û–í–ê–ù–ò–ï –° –ú–ê–¢–ï–ú–ê–¢–ò–ß–ï–°–ö–ò–ú–ò –°–í–û–ô–°–¢–í–ê–ú–ò**:
```typescript
    // Property-based —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—ã –¥–ª—è –∏–Ω–≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤
    describe("Message invariants", () => {
      it("should preserve message ordering", fc.assert(fc.property(
        fc.array(messageArbitrary),
        (messages) => {
          const sorted = sortMessagesByTimestamp(messages)
          // ‚àÄ i: sorted[i].timestamp ‚â§ sorted[i+1].timestamp
          return isChronologicallySorted(sorted)
        }
      )))
      
      // Unit —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—ã —Å –º–æ–∫-–∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏ (–±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–µ)
      it("should handle send message use case", async () => {
        const result = await pipe(
          sendMessageUseCase(validCommand),
          Effect.provide(MockMessageRepository),
          Effect.provide(MockNotificationService),
          Effect.runPromise
        )
        
        expect(result).toEqual(expectedMessageId)
      })
    })
```

–ö–û–ú–ê–ù–î–´ –ò –°–ö–†–ò–ü–¢–´:
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

- **–õ–∏–Ω—Ç**: `npm run lint` (—Å —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞–º–∏)
- **–¢–µ—Å—Ç—ã**: `npm test` (unit + property-based + integration)
- **ts-morph —Å–∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç—ã**: `npx ts-node scripts/<script-name>.ts`

–ü–†–û–í–ï–†–ö–ò –ö–ê–ß–ï–°–¢–í–ê:
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

‚úÖ **BEFORE COMMIT**:
- –í—Å–µ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –∏–º–µ—é—Ç —Ç–∏–ø–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∏
- Pattern matching –ø–æ–∫—Ä—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤—Å–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–∏ (.exhaustive())
- –ù–µ—Ç –ø—Ä—è–º—ã—Ö –æ–±—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏–π –∫ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–∏–º —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞–º –≤ CORE
- –í—Å–µ Effect'—ã –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç—Å—è —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ pipe()
- TSDoc —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç –∏–Ω–≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç—ã –∏ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å

‚úÖ **BEFORE MERGE**:
- –ê—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç (CORE ‚Üî SHELL —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ)
- Property-based —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—ã –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã

payload.text:
**Planning schema and audit table updates**

I‚Äôm outlining a multi-step plan to unify session tables with connect-pg-simple compatibility, add an audit table for session metadata like IP and user agent, and update related code and migrations accordingly. I‚Äôll need to adjust schema definitions, consider foreign key references, make sure types and exports align, and decide on testing and documentation steps.

**Planning session and audit table updates**

I'm working through how to update the session and audit tables, focusing on adding columns, foreign keys, and keeping relationships consistent with existing tables like securityAlerts. I want to align new fields with `connect-pg-simple` usage, ensure updated types generate properly, and think through whether changing references from sessions to the audit table makes sense while minimizing breakage.

**Planning schema and session updates**

@@
-import { pgTable, text, timestamp, uuid } from "drizzle-orm/pg-core";
-
-// CHANGE: Security telemetry tables for session tracking and anomaly detection
-// WHY: Persist login metadata to support suspicious activity detection (multiple geo-locations)
-// QUOTE(–¢–ó): "–æ—Ç–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è ... IP-–∞–¥—Ä–µ—Å ... –ì–µ–æ–ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è ... –£—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∏ –±—Ä–∞—É–∑–µ—Ä" / "–ø–æ–¥–æ–∑—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏"
-// REF: REQ-SEC-SESSIONS
-// FORMAT THEOREM: ‚àÄs ‚àà Sessions: persisted(s) ‚Üí ‚àÉu: user(u) ‚àß u.id = s.userId
-// PURITY: CORE
-// INVARIANT: Each session row binds to exactly one user and single issued_at instant
-// COMPLEXITY: O(1) per session row
-export const sessions = pgTable("sessions", {
-	id: uuid("id").defaultRandom().primaryKey(),
-	userId: uuid("user_id").notNull(),
-	ipAddress: text("ip_address").notNull(),
-	city: text("city"),
-	country: text("country"),
-	userAgent: text("user_agent"),
-	issuedAt: timestamp("issued_at", { withTimezone: true })
-		.notNull()
-		.defaultNow(),
-	expiresAt: timestamp("expires_at", { withTimezone: true }),
-	signedOutAt: timestamp("signed_out_at", { withTimezone: true }),
-});
+import {
+	jsonb,
+	pgTable,
+	text,
+	timestamp,
+	uuid,
+	varchar,
+} from "drizzle-orm/pg-core";
+
+// CHANGE: Connect-pg-simple compatible session storage
+// WHY: Provide module-owned source of truth for sessions table used by express-session store
+// QUOTE(–¢–ó): "—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç —Å—Ç–æ–ª–±—Ü–æ–≤ –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω –±—ã—Ç—å: sid varchar primary key, sess jsonb not null, expire timestamp not null"
+// REF: AUTH-SESSIONS-COMPAT
+// FORMAT THEOREM: ‚àÄs ‚àà Sessions: persisted(s) ‚Üí (s.sid ‚â† null ‚àß s.sess ‚â† null ‚àß s.expire ‚â† null)
+// PURITY: CORE
+// INVARIANT: sid uniquely identifies serialized session payload with expiry
+// COMPLEXITY: O(1) per session row
+export const sessions = pgTable("sessions", {
+	sid: varchar("sid", { length: 255 }).primaryKey(),
+	sess: jsonb("sess").notNull(),
+	expire: timestamp("expire", { withTimezone: false }).notNull(),
+	updatedAt: timestamp("updated_at", { withTimezone: true })
+		.notNull()
+		.defaultNow(),
+});
+
+// CHANGE: Session telemetry separated from connect-pg-simple storage
+// WHY: Preserve IP/geo/user-agent audit trail without conflicting with session store schema
+// QUOTE(–¢–ó): "–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –≤—ã–Ω–µ—Å—Ç–∏ —ç—Ç–æ –≤ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—É—é —Ç–∞–±–ª–∏—Ü—É (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, auth_sessions_audit)"
+// REF: AUTH-SESSIONS-AUDIT
+// FORMAT THEOREM: ‚àÄa ‚àà AuthSessionAudits: persisted(a) ‚Üí ‚àÉu: user(u) ‚àß u.id = a.userId
+// PURITY: CORE
+// INVARIANT: Each audit row binds a user, optional session sid, and issued_at instant
+// COMPLEXITY: O(1) per audit row
+export const authSessionAudits = pgTable("auth_sessions_audit", {
+	id: uuid("id").defaultRandom().primaryKey(),
+	sessionSid: varchar("session_sid", { length: 255 }).references(
+		() => sessions.sid,
+		{ onDelete: "set null", onUpdate: "cascade" },
+	),
+	userId: uuid("user_id").notNull(),
+	ipAddress: text("ip_address").notNull(),
+	city: text("city"),
+	country: text("country"),
+	userAgent: text("user_agent"),
+	issuedAt: timestamp("issued_at", { withTimezone: true })
+		.notNull()
+		.defaultNow(),
+	expiresAt: timestamp("expires_at", { withTimezone: true }),
+	signedOutAt: timestamp("signed_out_at", { withTimezone: true }),
+	updatedAt: timestamp("updated_at", { withTimezone: true })
+		.notNull()
+		.defaultNow(),
+});
 
 export const securityAlerts = pgTable("security_alerts", {
 	id: uuid("id").defaultRandom().primaryKey(),
 	userId: uuid("user_id").notNull(),
-	sessionId: uuid("session_id").notNull(),
+	sessionAuditId: uuid("session_audit_id")
+		.notNull()
+		.references(() => authSessionAudits.id, {
+			onDelete: "cascade",
+			onUpdate: "cascade",
+		}),
 	alertType: text("alert_type").notNull(),
 	description: text("description"),
 	detectedAt: timestamp("detected_at", { withTimezone: true })
 		.notNull()
 		.defaultNow(),
 });
 
-export type SessionRow = typeof sessions.$inferSelect;
+export type SessionRow = typeof sessions.$inferSelect;
+export type AuthSessionAuditRow = typeof authSessionAudits.$inferSelect;
 export type SecurityAlertRow = typeof securityAlerts.$inferSelect;
*** End Patch

**Planning careful manual migration**

I‚Äôm weighing how to update defaults on user columns and add new ones while avoiding data loss from Drizzle's auto-generated migrations that may drop and recreate tables. Since Drizzle‚Äôs diff tool likely doesn‚Äôt detect renames, I‚Äôm thinking it‚Äôs safer to manually craft migration scripts to rename and preserve data, especially for sessions tables. I‚Äôll consider running `drizzle-kit generate` as a baseline, then tweak the migration and meta files by hand to maintain data integrity.

**Planning schema migration and generation**

My plan is to run `npm run drizzle:generate` first, then inspect and possibly tweak the generated SQL to safely rename tables or columns while preserving the final schema and snapshot accuracy. After that, I'll run `npm run build:schema` to update the distribution as needed.

payload.text:
**Analyzing NodeNext module resolution issue**

I'm sorting out why drizzle-kit fails with missing `.js` modules when using NodeNext and ts-node, suspecting the `.js` extensions in source imports don't match real compiled files. I‚Äôm piecing together whether build steps were run before, how ts-node‚Äôs ESM loader handles `.js` imports on `.ts` files, and if config like `allowImportingTsExtensions` affects this mismatch. This feels like a subtle runtime resolution quirk due to NodeNext‚Äôs strict extension handling versus ts-node‚Äôs on-the-fly transpilation.

**Evaluating schema import strategies**

I'm weighing how to handle import specifiers for the schema‚Äîwhether to enable .ts imports, use ts-node with aliases, or just point to the compiled dist .js file. The tricky part is that drizzle-kit‚Äôs CLI is CommonJS and may struggle with ESM or .ts imports, so using the built .js schema in dist might be the cleanest solution after confirming its format.

payload.text:
**Analyzing TypeScript import extension behavior**

I'm examining how TypeScript's `allowImportingTsExtensions` affects emitted JS import specifiers, particularly for `.ts` versus `.js` in schema files. It looks like keeping `.ts` imports in emitted JS risks runtime errors since Node won't find `.ts` files in `dist`. I‚Äôm considering how `drizzle-kit` and `ts-node` interplay to handle this, especially with ESM and `type: module`. The issue seems tied to Node resolving `.js` imports that don't exist after transpilation, hinting ts-node might not automatically rewrite `.js` imports to `.ts` during runtime transpilation. This is quite a nuanced import resolution puzzle!

**Analyzing import and build issues with Drizzle-kit**

I‚Äôm investigating why Drizzle-kit‚Äôs CommonJS require struggles with TypeScript `.ts` imports due to extension mapping and Node‚Äôs module resolution. After reviewing TypeScript‚Äôs behavior and `tsconfig` settings, I see it‚Äôs best not to switch imports to `.ts` but instead point Drizzle‚Äôs config to the compiled `.js` output in `dist`, ensuring builds run before generate or push commands for smooth operation. I'll update `drizzle.config.ts` accordingly and consider npm script changes to automate building.

**Planning schema build and script updates**

I‚Äôm working on adding comments to clarify using the `dist` folder for compiled schemas and updating `package.json` scripts to run the schema build before Drizzle commands. I‚Äôm considering avoiding recursion by running `tsc` directly in scripts rather than nesting `npm run` calls, and will patch `drizzle.config.ts` accordingly to follow best practices and ensure smooth generation.

payload.text:
**Evaluating automatic migration regeneration**

I'm considering how to fully automate migration creation without manual steps. Removing the existing drizzle meta to let `drizzle-kit generate` create a new baseline migration from the current schema looks promising since it avoids prompts and manual snapshots. However, I'm weighing risks like breaking incremental updates if the user already applied the old baseline. I want to keep migrations automatic while minimizing disruption, so I'll prepare to suggest this approach and clarify potential consequences for the user.

**Exploring automated migration generation options**

I'm investigating ways to automate migration generation since the current tool is stuck, considering whether to reset metadata or remove the `drizzle` folder‚Äîthough that might be destructive. I'm also thinking about scripting CLI prompts programmatically with tools like `expect`, `node -e`, or `script` to simulate TTY input, as piped input doesn't work due to TTY requirements; checking if `script` is available for this purpose next.

**Disabling Biome import sorting and formatting**

I‚Äôm figuring out how to disable Biome‚Äôs import sorting as the user requested by turning off the assist organizeImports action in biome.json. There are also format errors causing lint failures, so I‚Äôm considering disabling the formatter to prevent those, or relying on Biome‚Äôs auto-format with --write to resolve them. To satisfy the user‚Äôs request without breaking other rules, I plan to disable assist or organizeImports in Biome while experimenting with formatter settings to avoid ongoing errors.

payload.message:
I am looking for code that does ‚Äúdisable Biome import/format meddling while keeping Effect rules on all TS files‚Äù, is there existing code that can do this?

- Disabled Biome‚Äôs import sorting/formatting by turning off the assist pipeline and formatter in `biome.json` (`assist.enabled: false`, `formatter.enabled: false`). Biome now runs as lint-only and no longer reorganizes imports or formatting.
- Added Effect plugin rules globally in `eslint.config.mts` (`effect/dprint`, `effect/no-import-from-barrel-package`) and widened scope to all TS/TSX files.
- `npm run lint` now passes cleanly (0 errors/warnings).

Files changed: `biome.json`, `eslint.config.mts`, `package.json`, `package-lock.json`, plus Biome-applied formatting touched many TS files. Working tree is dirty with those changes; let me know if you want me to commit.

payload.text:
**Planning integration of effect SQL layer**

I'm mapping out how to introduce an Effect-based SQL layer that bridges `@effect/sql-pg` and `@effect/sql-drizzle` with the existing schema, aiming to create a new module for this in `src/core/db/effect.ts`. I want to keep changes minimal to avoid breaking the current `db` usage patterns, possibly by providing a new layer alongside the existing setup and ensuring everything fits the functional, effect-driven architecture the user wants.

import type { ConnectionOptions } from "node:tls"
import * as Pg from "pg"
import * as PgConnString from "pg-connection-string"
import Cursor from "pg-cursor"

const ATTR_DB_SYSTEM_NAME = "db.system.name"
const ATTR_DB_NAMESPACE = "db.namespace"
const ATTR_SERVER_ADDRESS = "server.address"
const ATTR_SERVER_PORT = "server.port"

/**
 * @category type ids
 * @since 1.0.0
 */
export const TypeId: TypeId = "~@effect/sql-pg/PgClient"

/**
 * @category type ids
 * @since 1.0.0
 */
export type TypeId = "~@effect/sql-pg/PgClient"

/**
 * @category models
 * @since 1.0.0
 */
export interface PgClient extends Client.SqlClient {
  readonly [TypeId]: TypeId
  readonly config: PgClientConfig
  readonly json: (_: unknown) => Fragment
  readonly listen: (channel: string) => Stream.Stream<string, SqlError>
  readonly notify: (channel: string, payload: string) => Effect.Effect<void, SqlError>
}

/**
 * @category tags
 * @since 1.0.0
 */
export const PgClient = Context.GenericTag<PgClient>("@effect/sql-pg/PgClient")

/**
 * @category constructors
 * @since 1.0.0
 */
export interface PgClientConfig {
  readonly url?: Redacted.Redacted | undefined

  readonly host?: string | undefined
  readonly port?: number | undefined
  readonly path?: string | undefined
  readonly ssl?: boolean | ConnectionOptions | undefined
  readonly database?: string | undefined
  readonly username?: string | undefined
  readonly password?: Redacted.Redacted | undefined

  readonly idleTimeout?: Duration.DurationInput | undefined
  readonly connectTimeout?: Duration.DurationInput | undefined

  readonly maxConnections?: number | undefined
  readonly minConnections?: number | undefined
  readonly connectionTTL?: Duration.DurationInput | undefined

  readonly applicationName?: string | undefined
  readonly spanAttributes?: Record<string, unknown> | undefined

  readonly transformResultNames?: ((str: string) => string) | undefined
  readonly transformQueryNames?: ((str: string) => string) | undefined
  readonly transformJson?: boolean | undefined
  readonly types?: Pg.CustomTypesConfig | undefined
}

/**
 * @category constructors
 * @since 1.0.0
 */
export const make = (
  options: PgClientConfig
): Effect.Effect<PgClient, SqlError, Scope.Scope | Reactivity.Reactivity> =>
  Effect.gen(function*() {
    const compiler = makeCompiler(
      options.transformQueryNames,
      options.transformJson
    )
    const transformRows = options.transformResultNames ?
      Statement.defaultTransforms(
        options.transformResultNames,
        options.transformJson
      ).array :
      undefined

    const pool = new Pg.Pool({
      connectionString: options.url ? Redacted.value(options.url) : undefined,
      user: options.username,
      host: options.host,
      database: options.database,
      password: options.password ? Redacted.value(options.password) : undefined,
      ssl: options.ssl,
      port: options.port,
      connectionTimeoutMillis: options.connectTimeout
        ? Duration.toMillis(options.connectTimeout)
        : undefined,
      idleTimeoutMillis: options.idleTimeout
        ? Duration.toMillis(options.idleTimeout)
        : undefined,
      max: options.maxConnections,
      min: options.minConnections,
      maxLifetimeSeconds: options.connectionTTL
        ? Duration.toSeconds(options.connectionTTL)
        : undefined,
      application_name: options.applicationName ?? "@effect/sql-pg",
      types: options.types
    })

    pool.on("error", (_err) => {
    })

    yield* Effect.acquireRelease(
      Effect.tryPromise({
        try: () => pool.query("SELECT 1"),
        catch: (cause) => new SqlError({ cause, message: "PgClient: Failed to connect" })
      }),
      () =>
        Effect.promise(() => pool.end()).pipe(
          Effect.interruptible,
          Effect.timeoutOption(1000)
        )
    ).pipe(
      Effect.timeoutFail({
        duration: options.connectTimeout ?? Duration.seconds(5),
        onTimeout: () =>
          new SqlError({
            cause: new Error("Connection timed out"),
            message: "PgClient: Connection timed out"
          })
      })
    )

payload.text:
**Planning effect-sql database integration**

I‚Äôm thinking about creating a new module to combine PgClient and @effect/sql-drizzle into a Layer that can run effect-based queries. I want to provide this layer in the server so it‚Äôs actually used, maybe starting it in the server entry point and adding an effect-based health check to confirm usage. I‚Äôm going to check how the server is structured to figure out the best integration point without refactoring too much existing code.

**Planning effect-sql integration**

I‚Äôm thinking about how to introduce effect-sql and layering into the server‚Äôs DB access, possibly by creating new Effect layers for PgClient and DrizzleDb. I want to combine these with schema validation from @effect/schema and configure the layers using environment variables or fallback to process.env for simplicity. I‚Äôm also considering how to organize this code in new modules to keep the design tidy.

payload.text:
**Creating an Effect DB Layer**

I'm working on building a database layer using `PgClient.layer` with a typed connection URL wrapped by `Redacted.make`. I‚Äôm planning a new module to combine `PgClient` and `SqlDrizzle` layers and considering schema validation with `@effect/schema`. I want to refactor the existing `db.ts` to expose this effect-based DB layer but wonder if using direct `drizzle` calls might stay simpler for RESTful use.

**Adding new Effect database layers**

I'm adding new exported Effect layers for the database using @effect/sql-pg and @effect/sql-drizzle while keeping the existing db for backward compatibility. I'll include helper functions to run effects with these layers, carefully typing them to simplify usage. I'll also incorporate related schema validation and consider configuration updates to fully integrate the new Effect-based approach.

**Revising database effect setup**

I'm working on enhancing the `effect.ts` file by refining imports and ensuring proper layer typing and composition, especially around `PgClient`, `SqlDrizzle`, and potentially `SqlClient`. I want to confirm that the effect layering with configuration and schema integration works smoothly, and consider adding schema validation with `@effect/schema` in a dedicated validation module. This will help make the database interaction more robust and clearly typed.

**Updating database effect exports and integration**

I'm planning to add new exports and helpers in `src/shell/db.ts` for the `effect` layer like `DrizzlePgLive` and functions to run effects, while making sure existing code compatibility and lint rules hold. I'm also thinking about importing relevant types and considering if the `tsconfig.json` needs plugin changes to support the new effect library integration.

**Examining PgDrizzle types and schema validation**

I'm exploring how to import and type `PgDrizzle`, considering its nature as a Tag subclass and its use in effect environments. I‚Äôm setting up schema validation using `@effect/schema` and `@handfish/drizzle-effect`, checking method names like `trim` and `lowercase` to ensure compatibility and considering whether to keep refinements minimal to avoid compile issues.

payload.text:
**Adjusting schema imports and typing environment variables**

I‚Äôm refining how schema functions from the Schema module are composed using pipe to correctly apply trimmed, lowercased, and minLength. Then I‚Äôm tackling type issues importing DEVELOPMENT_DATABASE_URL by considering adding a declaration file in the scripts directory to properly type the module without ts-ignore, balancing type safety and simplicity.

**Resolving DrizzleConfig type mismatch**

I'm navigating the type conflict where `layerWithConfig` expects a non-generic `DrizzleConfig` with a schema typed as `Record<string, never>`, but the actual schema is more complex. I'm considering type assertions like casting schema as `unknown` or `Record<string, never>`, omitting the schema to keep things simple but lose typing, or importing and aligning the `DrizzleConfig` type to reduce mismatch and preserve inference. The goal is to find a minimal, type-safe fix without complicating usage.

**Refining types and effect handling**

I'm working on improving type safety by defining DrizzleConfig with the schema type and switching from Promise to Effect returns to align with lint rules. I'll also fix unsafe environment variable assignments and enhance string validation with trimmed and lowercased combinators, updating related files accordingly.

summary.text:
**Adjusting schema imports and typing environment variables**

I‚Äôm refining how schema functions from the Schema module are composed using pipe to correctly apply trimmed, lowercased, and minLength. Then I‚Äôm tackling type issues importing DEVELOPMENT_DATABASE_URL by considering adding a declaration file in the scripts directory to properly type the module without ts-ignore, balancing type safety and simplicity.

**Resolving DrizzleConfig type mismatch**

I'm navigating the type conflict where `layerWithConfig` expects a non-generic `DrizzleConfig` with a schema typed as `Record<string, never>`, but the actual schema is more complex. I'm considering type assertions like casting schema as `unknown` or `Record<string, never>`, omitting the schema to keep things simple but lose typing, or importing and aligning the `DrizzleConfig` type to reduce mismatch and preserve inference. The goal is to find a minimal, type-safe fix without complicating usage.

**Refining types and effect handling**

I'm working on improving type safety by defining DrizzleConfig with the schema type and switching from Promise to Effect returns to align with lint rules. I'll also fix unsafe environment variable assignments and enhance string validation with trimmed and lowercased combinators, updating related files accordingly.

payload.text:
**Resolving schema and effect layer type issues**

I‚Äôm working through type mismatches in the validation schema by removing refinements and using createInsertSchema directly to fix errors. Then, I‚Äôll simplify DrizzleEffectLayer by using the exported SqlDrizzlePg.layer without config to avoid unknown types and casting. Finally, I‚Äôm adjusting runWithEffectDb‚Äôs signature to include SqlError in the effect‚Äôs error union, importing SqlError properly, and cleaning up casts in db.ts.

summary.text:
**Resolving schema and effect layer type issues**

I‚Äôm working through type mismatches in the validation schema by removing refinements and using createInsertSchema directly to fix errors. Then, I‚Äôll simplify DrizzleEffectLayer by using the exported SqlDrizzlePg.layer without config to avoid unknown types and casting. Finally, I‚Äôm adjusting runWithEffectDb‚Äôs signature to include SqlError in the effect‚Äôs error union, importing SqlError properly, and cleaning up casts in db.ts.

payload.message:
I am looking for code that does ‚Äúwire all newly installed Effect/SQL/Drizzle libraries into the project‚Äù, is there existing code that can do this?

- Added effect-driven DB wiring: `src/shell/db.ts` now exposes `PgClientLive` (from `@effect/sql-pg`), `DrizzleEffectLayer` (from `@effect/sql-drizzle`), and `runWithEffectDb` to run Effectful queries with typed SqlError channel, while keeping the existing Pool+drizzle client.
- Exposed Effect-derived schemas: new `src/core/schema/validation.ts` exports `createInsertSchema`/`createSelectSchema` derivations for `users` and `sessions` (uses `@handfish/drizzle-effect`, exported via `src/core/schema/index.ts`).
- Type plumbing: added `scripts/shared-database-url.d.ts` for typed imports, and enabled `@effect/language-service` plugin in `tsconfig.json`.
- Lint pipeline now includes Effect rules over all TS/TSX; Biome formatting/assist remain disabled to avoid import reshuffles. `npm run lint` passes.

Files touched (high level): `src/shell/db.ts`, `src/core/schema/validation.ts`, `src/core/schema/index.ts`, `scripts/shared-database-url.d.ts`, `tsconfig.json`, plus config (`biome.json`, `eslint.config.mts`) and lockfiles.

If you want, I can refactor one endpoint to demonstrate `runWithEffectDb` in practice or commit the current changes.

content.text:
I am looking for code that does ‚Äúwire all newly installed Effect/SQL/Drizzle libraries into the project‚Äù, is there existing code that can do this?

- Added effect-driven DB wiring: `src/shell/db.ts` now exposes `PgClientLive` (from `@effect/sql-pg`), `DrizzleEffectLayer` (from `@effect/sql-drizzle`), and `runWithEffectDb` to run Effectful queries with typed SqlError channel, while keeping the existing Pool+drizzle client.
- Exposed Effect-derived schemas: new `src/core/schema/validation.ts` exports `createInsertSchema`/`createSelectSchema` derivations for `users` and `sessions` (uses `@handfish/drizzle-effect`, exported via `src/core/schema/index.ts`).
- Type plumbing: added `scripts/shared-database-url.d.ts` for typed imports, and enabled `@effect/language-service` plugin in `tsconfig.json`.
- Lint pipeline now includes Effect rules over all TS/TSX; Biome formatting/assist remain disabled to avoid import reshuffles. `npm run lint` passes.

Files touched (high level): `src/shell/db.ts`, `src/core/schema/validation.ts`, `src/core/schema/index.ts`, `scripts/shared-database-url.d.ts`, `tsconfig.json`, plus config (`biome.json`, `eslint.config.mts`) and lockfiles.

If you want, I can refactor one endpoint to demonstrate `runWithEffectDb` in practice or commit the current changes.

+  );

payload.message:
I am looking for code that does ‚Äúfix the weak typing/any around the register handler‚Äù, is there existing code that can do this?

- Added explicit request/response typing for registration: `src/shell/routes/registration.ts` now defines `RegisterRequestBody`, `RegisterError`/`RegisterSuccess`, and uses `Request<Record<string,string>, ...>` so body/query are not `any`.
- `respondError` is discriminated: `weak_password` always carries a policy; other errors return only the code, keeping the response union precise.
- `ensureUserAvailable` now returns `null` on conflict without comma-operator tricks; the rest of the pipeline stays typed.
- `npm run lint` (ESLint + Biome + TS) passes.

I did not commit yet because the working tree has many unrelated deleted files under `tz/.gitmeta/...`. If you want me to commit just the register typing fix, I‚Äôll stage only `src/shell/routes/registration.ts` and leave the unrelated deletions untouched.

content.text:
I am looking for code that does ‚Äúfix the weak typing/any around the register handler‚Äù, is there existing code that can do this?

- Added explicit request/response typing for registration: `src/shell/routes/registration.ts` now defines `RegisterRequestBody`, `RegisterError`/`RegisterSuccess`, and uses `Request<Record<string,string>, ...>` so body/query are not `any`.
- `respondError` is discriminated: `weak_password` always carries a policy; other errors return only the code, keeping the response union precise.
- `ensureUserAvailable` now returns `null` on conflict without comma-operator tricks; the rest of the pipeline stays typed.
- `npm run lint` (ESLint + Biome + TS) passes.

I did not commit yet because the working tree has many unrelated deleted files under `tz/.gitmeta/...`. If you want me to commit just the register typing fix, I‚Äôll stage only `src/shell/routes/registration.ts` and leave the unrelated deletions untouched.

payload.text:
**Proposing strict typing enforcement**

I am exploring how to enforce always explicitly typed inputs and outputs in the codebase, especially for functional effect-style and Express handlers. It seems best to enable ESLint rules like `@typescript-eslint/explicit-function-return-type`, `explicit-module-boundary-types`, and `no-explicit-any` to catch missing typings. For Express `RequestHandler`, a custom lint or a restricted import pattern could enforce typed generics, but this might be complex to implement and disruptive given current untyped code. I plan to suggest configuring these rules in the ESLint config and recommend gradual adoption, possibly with guidance rather than an immediate patch.

payload.message:
I am looking for code that does ‚Äúfail CI when inputs/outputs aren‚Äôt explicitly typed (especially on Express handlers)‚Äù, is there existing code that can do this?

We can enforce this with ESLint (no new tool needed), by enabling the strict TypeScript rules and adding a guard against unparameterized Express handlers:

- Add to `eslint.config.mts` rules (these will red-flag any missing types):
  - `@typescript-eslint/explicit-function-return-type: "error"`
  - `@typescript-eslint/explicit-module-boundary-types: "error"`
  - `@typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any: "error"` (you already ban `unknown`; this closes the other gap)

- Guard Express handlers from default `any` generics:
  - Introduce a local alias, e.g. `type TypedHandler<P, Res, Body, Query> = RequestHandler<P, Res, Body, Query>;` and forbid raw `RequestHandler` import via `no-restricted-imports` on `"express"` with a message ‚Äúuse TypedHandler with explicit generics‚Äù.

- Keep `strict` TS + `noImplicitAny` (already on) and your existing `no-unsafe-*` rules; they will combine with the above to force explicit input/output types everywhere.

If you want, I can apply the config changes and add the `TypedHandler` helper + `no-restricted-imports` rule so the analyzer immediately blocks any untyped handler usage.

summary.text:
**Proposing strict typing enforcement**

I am exploring how to enforce always explicitly typed inputs and outputs in the codebase, especially for functional effect-style and Express handlers. It seems best to enable ESLint rules like `@typescript-eslint/explicit-function-return-type`, `explicit-module-boundary-types`, and `no-explicit-any` to catch missing typings. For Express `RequestHandler`, a custom lint or a restricted import pattern could enforce typed generics, but this might be complex to implement and disruptive given current untyped code. I plan to suggest configuring these rules in the ESLint config and recommend gradual adoption, possibly with guidance rather than an immediate patch.

**Adding explicit return types**

I'm sorting out proper return types, especially for fetchInvitations, which returns a Promise with a query builder that behaves like a Promise, so I'll mark it as `Promise<InvitationListRow[]>`. For toInvitationView and other functions in registration.ts, I'll add explicit return types based on existing types or define them inline. Also planning to type utility functions like buildAuditTimestamps and resolveSsl for better clarity.

*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: src/shell/routes/registration.ts
@@
-const findActiveInvitation = (tokenHash: string) =>
+type InvitationRow = typeof registrationInvitations.$inferSelect;
+type UserRow = typeof users.$inferSelect;
+
+const findActiveInvitation = (tokenHash: string): Promise<InvitationRow | undefined> =>
   db.query.registrationInvitations.findFirst({
     where: (invites, { and, eq: eqFn, gt, isNull, or }) =>
       and(
         eqFn(invites.tokenHash, tokenHash),
         eqFn(invites.status, "pending"),
         or(isNull(invites.expiresAt), gt(invites.expiresAt, sql`now()`)),
       ),
   });
 
-const findUserByEmail = (email: string) =>
+const findUserByEmail = (email: string): Promise<UserRow | undefined> =>
   db.query.users.findFirst({
     where: (tbl, { eq: eqFn }) => eqFn(tbl.email, email),
   });
 
 const ensureUserAvailable = (
-  invitation: typeof registrationInvitations.$inferSelect,
+  invitation: InvitationRow,
   res: TypedResponse,
-) =>
+): Promise<InvitationRow | null> =>
   findUserByEmail(invitation.email).then((existingUser) =>
     existingUser
       ? (() => {
         respondError(res, 409, "user_exists");
         return null;
@@
 const createUserFromInvitation = (
-  invitation: typeof registrationInvitations.$inferSelect,
+  invitation: InvitationRow,
   password: string,
-) =>
+): Promise<{ readonly invitation: InvitationRow; readonly user: UserRow } | null> =>
   db
     .insert(users)
     .values({
       email: invitation.email,
       firstName: invitation.firstName,
@@
     })
     .returning()
     .then(([user]) => (user ? { invitation, user } : null));
 
 const createMembershipForInvitation = (
-  invitation: typeof registrationInvitations.$inferSelect,
+  invitation: InvitationRow,
   userId: string,
-) =>
-  db.insert(departmentMemberships).values({
-    userId,
-    departmentId: invitation.departmentId,
-    positionId: invitation.positionId,
-    role: "manager",
-    assignedBy: invitation.invitedBy,
-  });
+) =>
+  db
+    .insert(departmentMemberships)
+    .values({
+      userId,
+      departmentId: invitation.departmentId,
+      positionId: invitation.positionId,
+      role: "manager",
+      assignedBy: invitation.invitedBy,
+    })
+    .then(() => undefined);
 
-const acceptInvitation = (invitationId: string, userId: string) =>
+const acceptInvitation = (invitationId: string, userId: string): Promise<void> =>
   db
     .update(registrationInvitations)
     .set({
       status: "accepted",
       acceptedAt: now(),
@@
     })
     .where(eq(registrationInvitations.id, invitationId));
 
 const processRegistration = (
   tokenHash: string,
   password: string,
   req: TypedRequest,
   res: TypedResponse,
-) =>
+): Promise<void> =>
   findActiveInvitation(tokenHash)
     .then(
       (invitation) => invitation ?? respondError(res, 404, "invitation_not_found_or_expired"),
     )
*** End Patch

     existingUser
       ? (() => {
         respondError(res, 409, "user_exists");

payload.text:
**Planning Effect-based refactor for auth and invitations**

I‚Äôm mapping out how to rewrite auth, registration, and invitation functions to use Effect.Effect instead of Promises, while keeping Express handlers compatible. I‚Äôll focus on flagged files‚Äîauth.ts, registration.ts, invitations‚Äîcreating typed Effect wrappers for DB queries and logic, and then running these Effects inside handlers with runPromise. This includes defining a custom DbError type and ensuring all functions have explicit return types, avoiding Promises entirely. I plan to start by editing auth.ts first.

summary.text:

I‚Äôll focus on flagged files‚Äîauth.ts, registration.ts, invitations‚Äîcreating typed Effect wrappers for DB queries and logic, and then running these Effects inside handlers with runPromise. This includes defining a custom DbError type and ensuring all functions have explicit return types, avoiding Promises entirely. I plan to start by editing auth.ts first.

-const fetchInvitations = (
+const fetchInvitations = (
 	statusFilter: InvitationStatus | null,
 	emailFilter: string | null,
-): Async<InvitationListRow[]> => {
+): Effect.Effect<ReadonlyArray<InvitationListRow>, DbError> =>
+	Effect.tryPromise({
+		try: async () => {
+			const base = db
+				.select({
+					id: registrationInvitations.id,
+					tokenPlaintext: registrationInvitations.tokenPlaintext,
+					email: registrationInvitations.email,
+					firstName: registrationInvitations.firstName,
+					lastName: registrationInvitations.lastName,
+					status: registrationInvitations.status,
+					expiresAt: registrationInvitations.expiresAt,
+					createdAt: registrationInvitations.createdAt,
+					acceptedAt: registrationInvitations.acceptedAt,
+					departmentName: departments.name,
+					positionTitle: positions.title,
+					invitedBy: registrationInvitations.invitedBy,
+				})
+				.from(registrationInvitations)
+				.leftJoin(
+					departments,
+					eq(registrationInvitations.departmentId, departments.id),
+				)
+				.leftJoin(
+					positions,
+					eq(registrationInvitations.positionId, positions.id),
+				);
+
+			const statusCondition = statusFilter
+				? eq(registrationInvitations.status, statusFilter)
+				: null;
+			const emailCondition = emailFilter
+				? ilike(registrationInvitations.email, `%${emailFilter}%`)
+				: null;
+
+			const scoped = statusCondition && emailCondition
+				? base.where(and(statusCondition, emailCondition))
+				: statusCondition
+					? base.where(statusCondition)
+					: emailCondition
+						? base.where(emailCondition)
+						: base;
+			return scoped.orderBy(desc(registrationInvitations.createdAt));
+		},
+		catch: (cause) => ({ _tag: "DbError", cause }),
+	});

-		: base;
-	return scoped.orderBy(desc(registrationInvitations.createdAt));

payload.text:
**Rewriting auth and related modules with Effect**

I'm rewriting auth.ts to fully use Effect instead of Promises, typing errors explicitly without unknown, and fixing lint issues. I‚Äôm converting DB calls with typed error handling, reworking handlers like postLogin and getMe using Effect.gen, and adjusting respondError to return void. Then I'll tackle invitations and registration similarly, wrapping async logic into Effects with clear error types and sequential flow. This will be a big but manageable rewrite across these files, starting with auth.ts.
